net.sf.mmm.util.exception.api

Class NlsRuntimeException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • net.sf.mmm.util.exception.api.NlsRuntimeException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, NlsThrowable, AttributeReadMessage, AttributeReadMessageCode, AttributeReadUuid, NlsObject
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AlreadyInitializedException, BufferExceedException, BusinessErrorUserException, CliException, ComposedException, ContainerGrowthException, DuplicateObjectException, IllegalCaseException, IllegalDateFormatException, IllegalWildcardSequenceException, NlsClassCastException, NlsFormatterChoiceNoElseConditionException, NlsFormatterChoiceOnlyElseConditionException, NlsIllegalArgumentException, NlsIllegalStateException, NlsNullPointerException, NlsParseException, NlsRuntimeWrapperException, NlsUnsupportedOperationException, NodeCycleException, NotInitializedException, NumberConversionException, ObjectDisposedException, ObjectMismatchException, ObjectNotFoundException, PersistenceException, PojoPathException, PojoPropertyNotFoundException, ReadOnlyException, ReflectionException, RemoteInvocationCallFailedException, ResourceAmbiguousException, ResourceMissingException, ResourceNotAvailableException, ResourceNotWritableException, ResourceUriUndefinedException, RuntimeIoException, SearchTimeoutException, SecurityErrorUserException, StreamClosedException, TechnicalErrorUserException, TransactionCommitException, TransactionNotActiveException, TransactionRollbackException, UnknownCollectionInterfaceException, ValidationErrorUserException, ValueException, XmlException

    public abstract class NlsRuntimeException
extends RuntimeException
implements NlsThrowable, Cloneable
    This is an abstract base implementation of NlsThrowable based on RuntimeException. For further details see NlsThrowable. For an example read the package javadoc or see the source code of the derived exceptions.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)
    See Also:
    NlsThrowable, Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • createUuid

        protected UUID createUuid()
        This method creates a new UUID.
        Returns:

      • getUuid

        public final UUID getUuid()
        This method gets the UUID of this object. When the object is created, a UUID is generated. In case the object is created from another object that already has a UUID, the existing UUID will be used (e.g. for chained exceptions).
        The UUID will appear in a stacktrace but NOT in the message. It will therefore be written to log-files if the NlsThrowable is logged. If you supply the UUID to the end-user in an error panel or popup (see Message), he can provide it with the problem report so an administrator or software developer can easily find the stacktrace in the log-files.
        Specified by:
        getUuid in interface AttributeReadUuid
        Returns:
        the UUID of this object. It may be null if this feature is NOT supported by the type of this object or turned of (it is turned on by default).

      • getMessage

        public String getMessage()
        This method gets the actual message that describes this object. Such message should contain contextual information to describe and track down the information, problem, warning or error. It is either technical and should help operators or developers to identify what happened or it will be information displayed to end-users and should be clear and easy to understand. For internationalization see Message and NlsMessage. In any case it should NOT contain sensitive information such as passwords or (detailed) personal data.
        Specified by:
        getMessage in interface AttributeReadMessage
        Overrides:
        getMessage in class Throwable
        Returns:
        the message text.
        See Also:
        Throwable.getMessage(), NlsThrowable, Message

      • isTechnical

        public boolean isTechnical()
        Determines if this is a technical exception.
        • A technical exception is an unexpected situation that is to be logged on error level and should be analyzed by the operators or software developers of the system. Further in such case the end-user can typically do nothing about the problem (except to retry his operation) and will typically not understand the problem. Therefore a generic message should be displayed to the end-user in such case. See TechnicalErrorUserException.
        • A non technical exception is called user failure. It is an undesired but NOT abnormal situation. It should be logged on a level less than error (typically info). The message is typically intended for to end-users and has to be easy to understand.
        This separation is intentionally not done via inheritance of technical and business exception base classes to allow reuse. However, if you want to have it this way, create such classes derived from NlsRuntimeException.
        Specified by:
        isTechnical in interface NlsThrowable
        Returns:
        true if this is a technical exception, false if this is a user error.
        See Also:
        NlsThrowable.isForUser()

      • isForUser

        public boolean isForUser()
        Specified by:
        isForUser in interface NlsThrowable
        Returns:
        true if the message of this exception is for end-users (or clients), false otherwise (for internal technical errors).

      • getCode

        public String getCode()
        This method gets the code that identifies the detailed type of this object. While UUID or ID are typically unique per instance of an object the code is unique for all instances of the exact same kind. So e.g. a particular kind of exception or ValidationFailure can be identified by its code. A simple generic implementation may return the classname or the key of the NLS message. However, the code should remain stable after refactoring (so at least after the rename the previous code should be returned as String literal). This code may be used as a compact identifier to reference the related problem or information as well as for automatic tests of error situations that should remain stable even if the message text gets improved or the locale is unknown.
        Specified by:
        getCode in interface AttributeReadMessageCode
        Returns:
        the message text.
        See Also:
        Throwable.getMessage(), NlsThrowable, Message

      • createCopyViaClone

        protected NlsRuntimeException createCopyViaClone(ExceptionTruncation truncation)
        Parameters:
        truncation - the ExceptionTruncation settings.
        Returns:
        the (truncated) copy.
        See Also:
        createCopy(ExceptionTruncation)

      • createCopy

        public NlsRuntimeException createCopy(ExceptionTruncation truncation)
        Returns a copy of the given exception where the specified details are removed. See ExceptionUtil for advanced usage and further details.
        NOTE:
        Implementations/subclasses can override the return type with the subclass. As Java does not support an implicit SELF generic and we do not want to overload all exceptions with a generic type. This default implementation is using clone to create a copy and truncate it as configured. However, a proper implementation would use the appropriate copy constructor instead.
        Specified by:
        createCopy in interface NlsThrowable
        Parameters:
        truncation - the ExceptionTruncation to configure what to remove. E.g. ExceptionTruncation.REMOVE_ALL.
        Returns:
        a truncated copy of this exception.

      • toString

        public Appendable toString(Locale locale,
                           Appendable appendable)
        appends the localized string representation of this exception. It is defined as following: 
        <classname>: [<custom-code>: ]<message>
        Specified by:
        toString in interface NlsThrowable
        Parameters:
        locale - is the Locale used for NlsThrowable.getLocalizedMessage(Locale).
        appendable - is the buffer to append to. Will be created as StringBuilder if null is provided.
        Returns:
        the provided Appendable or the created one if null was given.
